intro: Hieracium teberdifontis, commonly known as the Tiberdifontis hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
